content:
• Friday, January 11, 2019
  • GBR

    WRK, ZAGG, IEC and UNVR among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: GBR +12.8%. YETI +10.3%. IEC +7.7%. VISI +6.3%. ZAGG +5.1%.
    • Top Losers: LAUR -10%. WRK -3.6%. TESS -3.1%. UNVR -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • ERJ

    Embraer +2.2% as board ratifies Boeing deal after Brazil's OK

    • Embraer (NYSE:ERJ) is up 2.2% postmarket after its board ratifies a resolution to approve its strategic transaction with Boeing (NYSE:BA).
    • That follows word from the Brazilian government yesterday that it wouldn't veto the deal, the deal's likely biggest hurdle.
    • Via filing, the board authorizes the execution of the Master Transaction Agreement, the Contribution Agreement and other documents needed to consummate the deal.
    • It still calls for approval from Embraer's shareholders at an extraordinary meeting, as well as antitrust OKs.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMRT

    Stein Mart -8.9% as nine-week holiday sales fall 3.3%

    • Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT) has slid 8.9% in postmarket trading after posting November/December sales that fell 3.3% Y/Y.
    • Comparable-store sales for the nine-week period ended Jan. 5 fell 3.3% on a shifted basis, compared to a similar period ended Jan. 6. 2018.
    • That reflects lower store traffic that was partly offset by higher average unit retail and digital sales growth of 20%, the company says.
    • That's below company expectations, but “Notwithstanding our holiday sales, fiscal 2018 operating results will be significantly better than last year," says CEO Hunt Hawkins.
    • The company will provide Q4 and 2018 results after the close on March 13, with a conference call to come that day. It's also presenting at the 2019 ICR Conference on Monday at 3:30 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 13 Comments
  • CJREF

    Corus hits seven-month high after strong TV results

    • Corus Entertainment (OTCPK:CJREF) rose 6.2% in U.S. trading today after Q1 earnings where adjusted basic EPS missed analyst estimates but the company easily topped the high end of revenue consensus.
    • The OTC shares reached their highest point since June on heavier than average volume as the company noted it returned to growth in TV ad revenue thanks to higher demand and a solid fall schedule. Shares rose 5.8% in Toronto.
    • Given a strong TV quarter, Corus' results were well ahead of RBC expectations, analyst Drew McReynolds wrote -- reiterating a Sector Perform rating with C$7 price target, implying 23.5% upside from today's close. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Meanwhile, NBF's Adam Shine liked revenues and EBITDA, and has an Outperform rating with a price target boosted to C$6.50 from C$6.00.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • YETI

    Yeti pops 6% on boosted outlook

    • Reporting preliminary Q4 net sales increase of 19% to $241.2M, Yeti (NYSE:YETI) updates full-year 2018 guidance.
    • The company now sees adjusted operating income as a percent of net sales of 15.7%-15.9% vs. 15.2%-15.5% previously.
    • Adjusted net income is now expected at $0.88-$0.90 per share vs. $0.79-$0.82 previously.
    • Adjusted EBITDA is now seen at $147M-$149M vs. $141-$144M previously.
    • The company is presenting at a conference on Monday.
    • Shares +5.8% after hours
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM

  • Oil slips to end nine-session win streak but climbs 8% for the week

    • Crude oil prices fell today to snap a nine-session winning streak but still ended the week nearly 8% higher, as production cuts by major producers, a weaker dollar and further export declines from sanctioned Iran lifted prices; February WTI settled -1.9% to $51.59/bbl, Brent -1.7% to $60.61/bbl.
    • "A major bull-run is still far from formulating, and prices are still close to 30% lower than the recent highs in October,” says Schneider Electric commodity analyst Robbie Fraser, but for the near-term, "the OPEC+ cuts, the continuous drop in Iranian exports, and a weaker dollar could help support crude prices."
    • Analysts at BofA Merrill Lynch think the Federal Reserve may help support oil prices later in the year: “An eventual shift in the U.S. monetary tightening path in the coming months could lead to a weaker dollar this year, a risk-on rally, and a major uplift in inflation assets like oil into the summer. We are constructive on oil because the Saudi [supply] put was triggered and see a Fed [demand] put eventually kicking in too.”
    • Separately, OPEC is considering an aggressive public influence campaign aimed at U.S. lawmakers and the White House, a first in its 60-year history, to send a message that the cartel plays a vital role in stabilizing oil prices and helping the U.S. economy, WSJ reports.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 11 Comments
  • IRDM

    Iridium +7.5% with last 10 NEXT satellites delivered to orbit

    • Iridium Communications (NASDAQ:IRDM) is flying higher today, up 7.5%, after noting SpaceX successfully delivered the final 10 Iridium NEXT satellites to low earth orbit.
    • That brings the fleet to its total 75, after the last of eight launches that deployed the next-generation satellites.
    • The 10 birds have communicated with Iridium's Satellite Network Operations Center and are ready for on-orbit testing.
    • Iridium has invested some $3B in the next-gen network and now expects a "capex holiday" of a decade or more where it expects to see significant cash generation from services.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 12 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix pops 4% as UBS, Raymond James add bullish views

    • Netflix (NFLX +4.3%) shares brush aside Citron's concerns to rank among today's top gainers on the S&P 500 after UBS upgraded shares to Buy from Neutral and Raymond James raised its rating to Strong Buy from Outperform.
    • At UBS, analyst Eric Sheridan sees upside for NFLX subscriber growth over the near to medium term, and current subscriber metrics such as growth, churn, spend and consumption are tracking inline to better than the company's Q4 guidance and commentary.
    • After six months of stock underperformance as key debates emerged about competition, margins and free cash flow, the debates are better understood by investors and reflected in NFLX's current stock price, Sheridan says.
    • RayJay's Justin Patterson, which raised his stock target to $450, expects upside to NFLX revenue and earnings through 2020 and believes the combination of positive revisions and emerging signs of long-term profit potential will yield strong share price upside, given underperformance in H2 2018 vs. traditional media such as Disney and Comcast.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 17 Comments
  • CNTF

    Microcaps dominate tech movers

    • Gainers: China TechFaith Wireless Communication Technology (NASDAQ:CNTF) +14%. Kopin Corporation (NASDAQ:KOPN) +11%. TESSCO Technologies Incorporated (NASDAQ:TESS) +10%. Inseego (NASDAQ:INSG) +9%. SMTC Corporation (NASDAQ:SMTX) +9%.
    • Losers: Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) -24%. Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) -18%. SemiLEDs Corporation (NASDAQ:LEDS) -12%. Borqs Technologies (NASDAQ:BRQS) -12%. SPI Energy (NASDAQ:SPI) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • VFC

    VF Corp. -2% as Deutsche Bank downgrades on global macro concerns

    • VF Corp. (VFC -2%) is lower after Deutsche Bank downgrades shares to Hold from Buy with a $76 price target, cut from $104, citing rising concerns around the global macro environment which has the firm re-evaluating companies in its universe such as VFC that have high international exposure (42% of revenues).
    • While Deutsche Bank still expects trends at Vans to remain solid in Q3, it is concerned about tough comparisons going forward and sees risks to sales slowing faster than expected, especially as fashion shifts and Nike takes back market share.
    • The firm also thinks growth at Timberland will be modest over the next year, North Face's reliance on strong European trends could become a headwind and margin upside is limited as cost and mix become less favorable.
    • Deutsche Bank cuts its FY 2020 EPS forecast to $4.11 from $4.24 previously and $0.06 below Wall Street consensus, and believes VFC no longer warrants a premium valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 8 Comments
  • SNX

    Synnex +13% as analysts praise broad strength in Q4 beat

    • Synnex (NYSE:SNX) is up 13.2% today and has reached its highest point since Aug. 30 after yesterday's Q4 beat showed broad highlights and stronger margins along with upside guidance.
    • The company also boosted its quarterly dividend by 7.1%.
    • Analyst reaction was positive, particularly to strength in the distribution business. Needham is sticking with its Strong Buy rating, citing a number of strengths including improving diversification; healthy fundamental demand; expanding margins; strong EPS growth; and attractive valuation. The firm has a $135 price target.
    • A higher target comes from Loop Capital and analyst Ananda Baruah: $160, implying 63% further upside after today's double-digit gains. The company's seeing solid, broad IT demand across its portfolio (including PCs, servers, storage and networking); meanwhile, acquisitions of Westcon-Comstor and Convergys could add about $2-$3 to EPS through 2020, Baruah says.
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate cuts 25 jobs in film restructuring; shares rise

    • Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF.A +2.9%, LGF.B +2.6%) is laying off 25 staffers as part of a restructuring in its Motion Picture Group.
    • That follows a tough year at the box office, where domestic share fell to 3.4% from 2017's 8%.
    • It also includes a shutdown of its Codeblack Films label, targeted at the African-American moviegoing market.
    • "As we look forward to the future with an ambitious and exciting 2019 theatrical slate, filled with big kick-ass crowd-pleasing movies as well as daring films with something to say, this is also a time to reassess some of the Motion Picture Group’s internal structure, processes and communication," group chairman Joe Drake says in an internal memo seen by THR.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • FTK

    Flotek Industries and Blueknight Energy Partners among Energy/Materials gainers; Ferrellgas Partners and Legacy Reserves among losers

    • Gainers: Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK) +89%. Blueknight Energy Partners (NASDAQ:BKEP) +12%. Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS) +7%. MFC Bancorp (NYSE:MFCB) +6%. Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) +5%.

    Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust leads financial gainers; Loop Industries and China Rapid Finance among losers

    • Gainers: Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLRP) +8%. MoneyGram International (NYSE:MGI) +8%. Cowen (NASDAQ:COWN) +7%. National Holdings (NASDAQ:NHLD) +5%. Greenhill & Co (NYSE:GHL) +5%.

    Microcaps tops midday movers

Aqua Metals (NASDAQ:AQMS) +15%. YRC Worldwide (NASDAQ:YRCW) +14%. HyreCar (NASDAQ:HYRE) +14%. Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) +13%. Rafael Holdings (NYSEMKT:RFL) +13%.

Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) -10%.

  • EBIX

    Ebix update shows continued plans for EbixCash IPO

    • In a business update, Ebix (EBIX +2.7%) says it's continuing to pursue plans for an IPO for its EbixCash operations in India and abroad, and announced intentions to expand in newer geographies.
    • In the near term, the company says it will move into geos like Muscat, AbuDhabi, Bahrain, Thailand and Malaysia among others, in addition to plans for "meaningful growth" in Dubai. It plans to focus on organic expansion "supplemented as possible via strategic acquisitions."
    • It's substantially expanded forex operations in the past few months, becoming a "dominant" provider in India.
    • And it says its Australia business achieved record results, other international insurance operations are strong, and the core U.S. insurance business is finishing 2018 strong with new exchange clients and four new annuities carriers.
    • Prospective cash from an EbixCash IPO would represent recouping interest considering most of Ebix's investments in India are in the form of loans granted to Indian subsidiaries. That would be used to grow businesses, repay borrowings and continue share buybacks.
    • And the company says it's accepted CEO Robin Raina's request to forgo cash salary in lieu of an equivalent amount of Ebix stock at its monthly prevailing value.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • PYX

    General Motors and G-III Apparel among consumer gainers

    • Gainers: Pyxus International (NYSE:PYX) +18%. Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) +13%. General Motors (NYSE:GM) +9%. PVH Co(NYSE:PVH) +8%. G-III Apparel Group (NASDAQ:GIII) +6%.
    • Losers: None
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks drops as Deutsche Bank makes short-term Sell

    • F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) is 1.6% lower after being added as a short-term Sell in Deutsche Bank's Catalyst Call.
    • There's limited visibility into orders, analyst Vijay Bhagavath writes, and potential for RFP delays as well as potential slowdowns in EMEA demand.
    • Since a 52-week high in late September, shares have slipped 15.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • TLRY

    Tilray leads pot stock rally, up 27%

    • Cannabis producer Tilray (TLRY +26.8%) is leading an up move in pot stocks after Peter Thiel-backed Privateer Holdings announced that it had no plans to trim its 75M-share stake in H1.
    • Selected tickers: (CGC +6.3%)(OTCPK:MJNA +0.1%)(ACB +9.1%)(OTCQB:PHOT +5.1%)(OTCPK:CBIS +0.5%)(APHA +7.3%)(OTCQX:TRTC +4%)(CRON +6.4%)(OTCQB:PMCB +8.7%)(OTC:FITX)(MJ +5.4%)(OTCQB:CBDS +11.4%)(OTCPK:BLOZF +2.7%)(OTCQB:KSHB +4.3%)(OTCQX:SPRWF +2.3%)(OTCPK:AGTK +6.5%)(OTCPK:AMMJ +4.5%)(OTCQB:AERO)(OTCQB:MCOA +3.7%)(OTC:HMLSF +5.4%)(OTCQB:CNAB +6.3%)(OTC:FSPM)(OTCQB:SRNA +13.8%)(OTCQX:MNTR +4.6%)(OTCPK:EDXC +4.5%)(OTCPK:ENDO +39.7%)(OTCPK:REFG +22.7%)

  • MNGA

    MagneGas -20% on registered direct offering

    • MagneGas (MNGA -20.3%) has entered into a securities purchase agreement with certain accredited institutional investors to purchase approximately $4.3M of its common stock in a registered direct offering and warrants to purchase its shares of common stock in a concurrent private placement. The combined purchase price for one share of common stock and each warrant will be $0.14.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 23 Comments
  • PIXY

    ShiftPixy down 9% post Q1 results revenue miss

    • ShiftPixy (PIXY -9.9%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 61.6% Y/Y to $10.52M.
    • Gross billings increased by 77% Y/Y to $70.9M.
    • Q1 gross profit increased by 171.8% Y/Y to $3.38M and margin expanded by 1,306 bps to 32.2%.
    • Q1 operating loss was $1.29M, compared to $3.34M a year ago.
    • Worksite employees increased by 64.3% Y/Y to average of 8,990 compared to an average of 5,470 for the quarter ended November 30, 2017.
    • Previously: ShiftPixy beats by $0.11, misses on revenue (Jan. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • FBC

    Flagstar Bancorp -2.9% as Sandler O'Neill steps to sidelines

    • Flagstar Bancorp (NYSE:FBC) slips 2.9% after Sandler O'Neill analyst R. Scott Siefers downgrades the stock to hold from a buy.
    • Earnings trends since its upgrade last summer have been mixed and visibility "very tricky," Siefers writes.
    • Mortgage gain on sale margin has been "main wildcard."
    • Outpermance relative to peers makes valuation less attractive.
    • Until this downgrade, FBC had 8 buy ratings.
    • Previously: Flagstar beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Oct. 23, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • TLRY

    Tilray leads healthcare gainers; Aratana Therapeutics and Puma Biotechnology among losers

    • Gainers: Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) +25%. Rafael Holdings (NYSEMKT:RFL) +20%. Bellerophon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BLPH) +12%. INSYS Therapeutics (NASDAQ:INSY) +11%. Realm Therapeutics (RLM) +10%.
    • Losers: Aratana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PETX) -26%. Fulgent Genetics (NASDAQ:FLGT) -13%. Twist Bioscience (NASDAQ:TWST) -7%. LogicBio Therapeutics (NASDAQ:LOGC) -7%. Puma Biotechnology (NYSE:PBYI) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • IPHI

    Inphi +5.4% as Citi opens coverage at Buy

    • Inphi (NYSE:IPHI) is up 5.4% following an initiation at Buy by Citi.
    • Analyst Wayne Loeb points to a significant benefit from the 5G ramp (with associated revenues climbing 31% this year), higher data rates in data centers and the increased need for high-bandwidth connections between regional data centers. He's forecasting 50% sales growth by 2020. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He's set a price target at $40, implying 15% upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • CEA

    Chinese airline stocks catch a bid

    • China Eastern Airlines (CEA +4.4%) and China Southern Airlines (ZNH +4.9%) both shoot up in morning trading.
    • The Chinese carriers have been sensitive to trade news coming out of Beijing and DC over the last few months. Both CEA and ZNH trade on the lower end of their 52-week range.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • TPIC

    TPI Composites wins Vestas supply deal, to open new blade factory in India

    • TPI Composites (TPIC +4.4%) is on the rise after announcing a multiyear supply agreement with Vestas Wind Systems (OTCPK:VWDRY -0.3%) to provide wind blades for India and export markets.
    • TPIC says the blades will be manufactured at a new four-line factory in India, which the company plans to open for production in Q1 2020.
    • TPIC currently produces blades for Vestas in China, Turkey and Mexico.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CZR

    Icahn stirs up the casino sector

    • CNBC in a followup to the report of Carl Icahn building a stake in Caesars Entertainment (CZR +5.8%) says Tilman Fertitta is still interesting in working a merger with Golden Nugget.
    • Icahn is no stranger to the casino business, the veteran investor bought the Tropicana in 2008 when it was bankrupt and just unloaded it last year for $1.85B. Just last week, Icahn purchased the deed to the closed Trump Plaza in Atlantic City and terminated a complicated lease agreement on the property. Icahn's overarching casino strategy isn't known yet.
    • Shares of Wynn Resorts (WYNN -0.4%) and MGM Resorts (MGM -0.1%) both pared losses when news of the Icahn-Caesars development broke. Empire Resorts (NYNY +3.5%) is the other casino stock showing moxie today.
    • Previously: Caesars +8% with Icahn snapping up shares (Jan. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 19 Comments
  • PETX

    Aratana down 27% as Stifel softens view

    • Aratana Therapeutics (PETX -26.9%) is down on 70% higher volume in early trade on the heels of a downgrade to Hold at Stifel. Analyst Jonathan Block also trimmed his price by 38% to $5 citing a thin pipeline and little progress on extending the duration of canine appetite stimulant Entyce (capromorelin oral solution).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 27 Comments
  • NTRS

    Capital markets stocks head into "challenging", "blurred" 2019: BofAML

    • Capital markets stocks face a "challenging" 2019, as the sector slides 31% from recent highs and has potential for swings either way, Bank of America Merrill Lynch analyst Michael Carrier writes in a note.
    • For trust banks, Northern Trust (NTRS -0.7%) cut to neutral on tough revenue view, reduced expense flexibility; raises State Street (STT -0.9%) to buy as challenges may already be priced in.
    • Among asset managers, Legg Mason (LM -1.6%) upgraded to neutral as flows hold up better than its rivals; cuts Franklin Resources (BEN -2.2%) on outflows, weaker markets and asset levels.
    • CME Group (CME -0.3%) cut to neutral.
    • Sees upside for most brokers; favors Morgan Stanley (MS -1.4%) and alternative asset managers like Carlyle Group (CG -0.8%); sees "decent" upside for online brokers like Schwab (SCHW -1%).
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    Activision -12% after 'Destiny' move; analysts stay bullish

    • Activision Blizzard (ATVI -12.2%) has come out of today's open down double digits after surprising many with news after yesterday's close that rights to its Destiny franchise were going to developer partner Bungie.
    • That's a move that could lose it hundreds of millions in revenue.
    • Analysts are fairly bullish after absorbing the news, however. Transferring the rights is a "logical decision" and good move considering the current state of the franchise, Baird says.
    • "We view the potential savings in operating expenses as a long-term positive,” writes Colin Sebastian, adding that the Destiny resources will be put toward projects with more long-term growth and profit potential. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Sebastian's still at Outperform and maintains a price target of $75, implying a healthy 66% upside.
    • And KeyBanc's Evan Wingren reiterated an Overweight rating despite lower estimates, expecting a "noisy report" for Q4. "We are reducing our FY19 and FY20 total revenue and EPS estimates on the removal of Destiny from our model and also slightly lower Blizzard expectations ... For FY19, we expect consensus to move lower, and expect ATVI to guide revenue and earnings down y/y when it reports in February."
    • Wingren's now-lower price target is $64 (42% upside).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 32 Comments
  • CZR

    Caesars +8% with Icahn snapping up shares

    • Carl Icahn is building a position in Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR), according to CNBC.
    • While the size of the position isn't known yet, the development is sure to throw an even brighter spotlight on the M&A potential for the casino operator.
    • Shares of Caesars are up 7.88% in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • IDEX

    Ideanomics signs agreement with Huaxi

    • Ideanomics (IDEX) has entered into an agreement with Huaxi Securities Co., Ltd as one of several underwriters to participate in the underwriting of the NTS Electric Bus initiative.
    • The said agreement forms part of underwriting and marketing of asset-backed securities in support of the Chinese-government mandated electric bus upgrade and replacement project.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • VMW

    Firms resume coverage of VMware at Neutral; shares -2.5%

    • VMware (NYSE:VMW) is 2.5% lower premarket as analysts pick up coverage again after the wrap-up of its transaction with Dell, and a pair of firms now say it's fairly valued.
    • Earlier Barclays resumed coverage at Overweight ($168 price target) and Citi resumed at Buy ($166 price target).
    • Now Goldman Sachs is Neutral amid the "context of potentially decelerating IT spend and a premium valuation relative to peers that accounts for the company’s near-term growth prospects." And Credit Suisse sees some positives, but it's Neutral "especially given a peaking enterprise IT infrastructure cycle, tougher license comps ahead, and broader macro deceleration." (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Goldman's target of $155 implies 4.1% upside, while CS has a $160 target (7.5% implied upside).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 2 Comments
  • FTK

    Flotek, Tilray, GM among premarket gainers

    • Flotek (NYSE:FTK) +108% on selling Florida Chemical Company, LLC.
    • ToughBuilt (NASDAQ:TBLT) +19%.

    • Embraer S.A. (NYSE:ERJ) +6% as Brazil government approves partnership with Boeing.
    • SYNNEX (NYSE:SNX) +5% on Q4 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • OESX

    Orion Lighting secures orders for LED lighting solutions

    • Orion Lighting (OESX -1.2%) secures $3.6M in awards for LED lighting solutions for U.S. Government Facilities.
    • OESX expects annual energy savings of ~50%.
    • The awards follow several projects completed for the same government entities over the recent past.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM

    ATVI and PCG among premarket losers

    • Aratana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PETX) -20%.
    • Autohome (NYSE:ATHM) -11%.

  • GM

    GM +6% after hiking guidance

    • General Motors (NYSE:GM) rallies after providing a business update to investors.
    • The company says it expects earnings growth in 2019 and forecasts EPS of $6.50 to $7.00 for the year vs. $5.95 consensus. Adjusted automotive free cash flow of between $4.5B and $6.0B is anticipated. billion.
    • GM also says that it expects 2018 EPS-diluted-adjusted and adjusted automotive free cash flow to exceed its prior guidance.
    • GM Chairman/CEO Mary Barra is hosting a webcast for investor analysts and institutional investors at 10 a.m. EST today to share other updates on the future of GM and take some Q&A. Expect some more updates from Detroit.
    • GM +6.26% premarket to $36.90.
    • Source: Press Release

  • CHS

    Chico's FAS to review operations, close 250 stores

    • Chico's FAS (NYSE:CHS) announces a series of strategic initiatives, including a retail fleet optimization plan and an expanded review of the company's operations.
    • "Our focus is on implementing those initiatives that drive the greatest levels of growth and profitability of our business," says CEO Shelly Broader.
    • As part of the new strategy, Chico's says it has made the strategic decision to rebalance the mix between its physical store presence with its digital network and to close at least 250 stores in the U.S. over a three-year period. Closings will be across the three brands and weighted to years two and three.
    • For Q4, the company anticipates a low double-digit decline in sales  and a mid-single digit decline in consolidated comparable sales. Gross margin rate is expected to decline approximately 500bps compared to a year ago, primarily driven by the initial ramp-up in costs from the company's omnichannel programs, more aggressive promotional cadence to clear through seasonal merchandise and deleverage of fixed costs from lower sales.
    • Shares of Chico's are up 1.9% in premarket trading.
    • Source: Press Release
